Class CPNCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • CPNCalculator
  • public class CPNCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculator for Cambridge-Polish Notation expressions (see the description in the assignment page) User can type in an expression (in CPN) and the program will compute and print out the value of the expression. The template provides the method to read an expression and turn it into a tree. You have to write the method to evaluate an expression tree. and also check and report certain kinds of invalid expressions

      GTNode<ExpElem> readExpr​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      Recursive helper method.
      void runCalculator()
      Run the calculator: loop forever: (a REPL - Read Eval Print Loop) - read an expression, - evaluate the expression, - print out the value Invalid expressions could cause errors when reading or evaluating The try-catch prevents these errors from crashing the program - the error is caught, and a message printed, then the loop continues.
      void setupGUI()
      Setup the gui

      • runCalculator

        public void runCalculator()
        Run the calculator: loop forever: (a REPL - Read Eval Print Loop) - read an expression, - evaluate the expression, - print out the value Invalid expressions could cause errors when reading or evaluating The try-catch prevents these errors from crashing the program - the error is caught, and a message printed, then the loop continues.

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate​(GTNode<ExpElem> expr)
        Evaluate an expression and return the value Returns Double.NaN if the expression is invalid in some way. If the node is a number => just return the value of the number or it is a named constant => return the appropriate value or it is an operator node with children => evaluate all the children and then apply the operator.

      • readExpr

        public GTNode<ExpElem> readExpr()
        Reads an expression from the user and constructs the tree.

      • readExpr

        public GTNode<ExpElem> readExpr​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Recursive helper method. Uses the hasNext(String pattern) method for the Scanner to peek at next token
